title: Balancer - Description

body.body: The balancer is fitted to control 'pulsing' within the engine. Without any form of balancer, the engine would 'pulse' each time the crankshaft rotates. This 'pulsing' would be felt as vibration which would amplify as the engine speed was increased.

The balancer has the effect of a counterbalance weight that creates an equal amount of energy in the opposite direction, and at the same time as that produced by the crankshaft, piston and connecting rod. Because the opposing pulses occur at the same point of crankshaft rotation, and are of an equal magnitude, a state of equilibrium or balance is reached.
The balancer is driven by the crankshaft and rotates at the same speed.
